page.title: 01THE COMMUNITY PROJECT
page.content: When the BBC wrote to primary schools in October 1984 inviting us to take part in the Domesday Project, we were delighted. We considered it a project ideally suited to primary aged children involving first hand experience to develop skills and concepts. An initial whole staff discusion with advisory teachers resulted in three members of staff preparing to run a joint project the following term. After an preliminary discussion, each child chose an area of our community to research. These included shops and facilities, services, communications, education, health care,social services, leisure pursuits,and local government. Groups of children worked cooperatively to plan their research. They arranged by letter or by phone to work in the playgroup, visit the elderly in the Day Centre, or look round the Police
